Specify current severity:
Mild: Symptoms are confined to only one setting (e.g., at home,
at school, at work, with peers).
Moderate: Some symptoms are present in at least two settings.
Severe: Some symptoms are present in three or more settings.
Intermittent Explosive Disorder
312.34 (F63.81)
A. Recurrent behavioral outbursts representing a failure to control
aggressive impulses as manifested by either of the following:
1. Verbal aggression (e.g., temper tantrums, tirades, verbal ar-
guments or fights) or physical aggression toward property,
animals, or other individuals, occurring twice weekly, on aver-
age, for a period of 3 months. The physical aggression does
not result in damage or destruction of property and does not
result in physical injury to animals or other individuals.
2. Three behavioral outbursts involving damage or destruction
of property and/or physical assault involving physical injury
against animals or other individuals occurring within a 12-
month period.
